One year ago today it was a very difficult Thanksgiving. After the acquisition of Stars Arena on November 4th, I barely slept for the next 3 weeks.

Our backs were against the wall with continued exploits, a website that was down, an ongoing wallet migration, and a nervous userbase that lost everything and put all their hope in me for a recovery. I had to finish a contentious acquisition, build a team in real time, secure the platform, secure capital, rebrand the app, and convince people to give me a chance to right the ship and still trust the platform when everyone else had left. The transition process was one of the most difficult periods Iâ€™ve ever experienced in my life.

I took my first night off for Thanksgiving but it was difficult to enjoy the time with everything lingering on my mind. The rebuild seemed impossible back then. It was such a steep mountain to climb to get people to trust using this app again. The SocialFi euphoria had come and went. That night was the first and only time I questioned the decision to take over the platform.

Fast forward one year to this Thanksgiving. Entire app secured and rebuilt with a V2 overhaul. Top web3 partnerships from all chains. Memecoin tipping. Badges. Solana integration. The social exchange. Dozens of viral campaigns. Countless bug fixes and optimizations. One of the best airdrops of 2024. $ARENA staking. Governance votes. A native Arena App Store. Arena Stages outcompeting X spaces. Amazing investors backing us. One of the best teams in the space. A community that most platforms can only dream of. $100M in total volume. User metrics at all time highs and on the verge of breaking out.

A year ago it was unlikely that weâ€™d survive. Now, itâ€™s hard to see us not being the #1 social crypto app around. Most of the apps we were competing with back then are no longer around. But The Arena is only just getting started now.

All I can feel now is deep gratitude. Iâ€™m thankful for the community who believed this was possible when no one else did. Iâ€™m thankful for my team who grinds to make this vision a reality. Iâ€™m thankful for those who backed us and supported us. Iâ€™m thankful that I get to wake up everyday and build the future with all of you.

Iâ€™m thankful for the community builders who will make this platform bigger than we ever can. Iâ€™m thankful for @avax and @AvalancheFDN and the support they always give because without them this would not be possible. Im thankful for everyoneâ€™s patience in letting us build out the vision in a space where metaâ€™s change every few hours. Iâ€™m thankful for all the lessons this space has taught me over the years. Iâ€™m thankful for the dark times where we grew stronger and were able to build the proper foundation.

I hope to continue to grow as a leader. I hope that we never forget why we started this journey in the first place. Early Arena users will earn a lot of money on this app, but we have the opportunity to do something much bigger. To build something truly special. Letâ€™s not take this for granted.

This means that, as of writing, communities can bribe their LP with $1 and that will direct ~$1.35 in PHAR emissions to that pair through vote incentives.

ğŸ”¥ğŸ”¥ğŸ”¥ğŸ”¥ğŸ”¥ğŸ”¥ğŸ”¥ğŸ”¥

Pharaoh is part of The Kingdom, a next gen ve(3,3) dex suite. Native to Avalanche and spearheaded by hardcore red chain builders like @LHBCrypto and @TopGunHatch, Pharaoh has always been about building out meaningful community incentives and making the red chain a better place for all builders and users.

I will make another post on the weekend about how Pharaoh does this through an incredible revenue generation model, and how ve(3,3)s need good revenue to sustain a healthy bribe economy, but for now I'll assume you are familiar with ve(3,3)s and just say that revenue *far* exceeds their emissions, and they deliver absolutely insane returns to voters. That's what makes all this possible - as a vote briber, you can leverage Pharaoh's revenue generation to make your incentives go further.

As is standard in ve(3,3)s, users are able to bribe voters to vote for a pool of their choosing. If you are a project lead and want to deepen liquidity for your pools, you can bribe them with incentives and more vePHAR votes will be directed to those pools on epoch flip. Shoutout to @SwolBeach for consistently being the highest bribers oh Pharaoh - they seem to get how this flywheel can benefit them, and have been using it for their community for months now.

It is fair to introduce myself. Name is iakov.
For five years I have been building Midas.Investments, a CeFi platform generating yields on-top of DeFi. Maximum AUM was $360 mln. Model did not work, we closed in December of previous year following the path of Celcius, BlockFi and FTX. It was impossible to build CeFi business, and CeFi model is a piece of shit for various reasons. Our 10x growth in AUM was in the end of 2021, which made us having long-tail of DeFi risk in portfolio in the end of bullish market. We tried many things to keep us alive, but they did not work.
The closure of Midas resulted in net loss for users of approx. 60 mil that was compensated with Midas token, all the remaining funds were distributed to users right away to not go in the long bankruptcy process. Now we are building the decentralized asset management protocol Locus.Finance, which aims to build the first omnichain vaults. The idea is to give retail users the access to the best investment opportunities in DeFi across all EVM chains and protocols.
Midas tokens will be swapped to Locus tokens, so this is our chance to make things right fixing our mistakes with our expertise of building accessible products for retail.
I am the man of vision. I see how DeFi can create the new layer of democratisation of wealth in the next 10 years. The traditional financial system is shit and favours only the institutions. Humanity deserves to have access to the sources of wealth accumulation and possibility to borrow and leverage on this tools. This is what we will build.
I also dig integral theory, cognitive science, contemplative spirituality, gaming and, of course, DeFi, the love of my work life.
Pleasure to be here, connecting with you, guys.
